article_text:
Ukrainian military was able to counterattack in the Zaporozhye region and liberated five settlements from the occupiers

This was reported by the press service of the Command of the Assault Troops of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, writes Espresso.

The paratroopers, together with other units of the Defense Forces of the Zaporozhye region, advanced and repulsed the enemy. Thus, the settlements of Zatyshshya, Malynivka, Vesele, Zelenyi Hai and Chervone were brought back under control.

“There is a real situation on the battlefield, when the Ukrainian military is fighting for every piece of our sacred land, for every one of our people. And for the soldiers of the Airborne Assault Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine – this is very important. “, – noted in the message.

VALENTYNA ROMANENKO - THURSDAY, 31 MARCH 2022, 12:51

Ukrainian Airborne Assault Troops together with other units of the Defence Forces have liberated five settlements in the Zaporizhzhia region from the Russian invading forces.

Source: press centre of the Airborne Assault Troops Command of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on Facebook

Quote: "Together with other units of the Zaporizhzhia region Defence Forces, airborne troops have already liberated such settlements as Zatyshshia, Malynivka, Vesele, Zelenyi Hai and Chervone".

Details: The report is accompanied by a photo of the invaders' destroyed equipment. The timeframe for the liberation of the settlements is not specified.

While Russia continues to attack Ukraine for over a month, the Ukrainian authorities have now claimed that its military forces have liberated five settlements from Russian control. The Ukrainian Ground Forces Command reported on Telegram that Ukrainian Air Assault Forces, along with other defensive forces units in the southern Zaporizhia area, have taken control of Zatyshshia, Malynivka, Vesele, Zelenyi Hai, as well as Chervone from Russian occupation.

"Together with other units of the Zaporizhzhia region Defence Forces, airborne troops have already liberated such settlements as Zatyshshia, Malynivka, Vesele, Zelenyi Hai and Chervone," said press centre of the Airborne Assault Troops Command of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on Facebook.

According to Anadolu Agency, Ukrainian military forces on Monday stated that Irpin, near Kyiv, was also recovered from Russian occupation. Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in his national speech on Monday also stated that Ukrainian forces had retaken Irpin, a vital town outside the capital, Kyiv. However, residents are still unable to return, according to Ukrinform.

Putin-led government has lost approximately 17,300 personnel: Ukraine

Ukrainian military forces have even claimed that the Putin-led government has lost approximately 17,300 personnel since the invasion began on February 24. According to Ukraine's report on Russian losses, more than 600 tanks, 75 fuel tanks, 131 helicopters, and 1,700 armoured personnel vehicles have been destroyed.

Apart from the ministry, Ukraine's Permanent Representative to the United Nations, Sergiy Kyslytsya said that Russia has lost more than 300 artillery systems, almost 100 rocket launcher systems, 54 air defence systems, as well as 7 ships, according to the Independent. The envoy further stated that this is an "unprecedented blow to Moscow, where the numbers of Soviet losses in Afghanistan pale in comparison,” as per media reports.

As a result of Russian aggression against Ukraine, nearly 1,189 people have lost their lives and 1,901 have been wounded in Ukraine, however the exact tally is probably much higher, as per United Nations estimates. The UN refugee agency also reported that over 4 million Ukrainians have migrated to various European nations, with millions more displaced within the country.

(Image: AP)

Ukrainian defenders have recaptured several villages in the Zaporizhia region.

The Ukrainian Ground Forces reported the news on Telegram, according to Ukrinform.

"Units of the Ukrainian Air Assault Forces, together with other units of the defense forces of the Zaporizhia region, have liberated the settlements of Zatyshshia, Malynivka, Vesele, Zelenyi Hai and Chervone from Russian occupation," the statement said.

Ukrinform reported earlier that the town of Irpin outside Kyiv was liberated from Russian invaders on March 28.
